intro: Anisocycla linearis, commonly known as the slender anisocycla, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Anisocycla linearis is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
